casebody.data:
Lawrence Verline WILDER, Sr., Plaintiff—Appellant, v. GLASS HEALTH ASSOCIATION, Defendant—Appellee, and Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Maryland, Defendant. No. 08-1085. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Aug. 21, 2008. Decided: Aug. 25, 2008. Lawrence Verline Wilder, Sr., Appellant Pro Se.

Before WILLIAMS, Chief Judge, and KING and DUNCAN, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Lawrence Verline Wilder, Sr., appeals the district court’s order denying his motion to vacate the order denying his motion to reopen a civil action. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Wilder v. Glass Health Ass’n, No. l:97-cv-02103-FNS (D.Md. Dec. 26, 2007). Wilder’s motion for appointment of counsel is denied. We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
